website_summaries.verdict: A heavy, high quality pan that produces delicious over-sized popovers.
pros: Non-stick pan has wide cup openings, making it easy to wipe clean
Design allows for evenly distributed heat for delicious, uniform popovers every time
Available in 2 sizes: grand and petite
Pan is heavy and built to last
cons: Pan is not safe for the dishwasher

customer_reviews.title: For Serious Popover Bakers!
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who are serious about your Popovers, you need this pan. Having made them in the past using a traditional muffin/cupcake pan with mixed results, I can tell you that this product is the one you need if you like popovers. They come out perfectly with a nice tight stem and huge puffy top. Perfect. Clean up is a breeze. Just wipe out with a soapy sponge. I attribute the improved performance to both the shape of the cup and the open structure which allows for airflow all around the cup... this allows for rapid, uniform heating during the high temp, initial baking period. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nom-stick feature really works.
customer_reviews.text: Used this pan to make individual Yorkshire Puddings. Put about a teaspoon of Canola oil in the bottom of each cup then put the pan into a 425 degree oven for a few minutes to preheat prior to adding chilled batter. Turned out perfectly and released from the pan easily. Going to try popovers next.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Have tried three different types of pop over pans. This one is the best I have tried thus far. They heat evenly and the non stick coating hasn't chipped off yet (happened on cheaper pans after 3 uses). I highly recommend this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I forgot how tasty popovers are until I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I forgot how tasty popovers are until I visited a Steak House recently. I searched the web for recipes and my first attempt was in regular muffin pans -- I am no chef. They were good but they did not look like the ones in the restaurant. I found these and they are wonderful. Easy cleanup -- I can be messy -- and very well constructed. The Good Housekeeping recipe makes exactly 6 popovers and combined with a little maple flavored butter and you have a great addition to your meal. I even considered cutting off the tops and filling them with tuna salad.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Adasiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing popovers! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Popovers are big where I'm from, but I'd always been too intimidated to make them. I found a recommendation for this pan when looking at recipes in the blogosphere. Bought it! Tried it! And they came beautifully. Way better than in a muffin pan. Taking them out is also super easy. Only one caveat is to be careful when washing the pan not the scratch it, but that's par for the course with nonstick. Would not put this in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Satni

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but not weighted like my King Author look-alike:(
customer_reviews.text: These looked exactly like a set I had purchased from King Author, however, is not weighted the same. I like this sized popovers better than the smaller ones, but I’ll check weight on items from now on. I prefer heavy duty bakeware that lasts a lifetime. Praying this one will last.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine, Royal Pain to Clean
customer_reviews.text: This product makes popovers just fine. But, I threw it away because it was just so hard to clean. I always buttered and floured it but the batter would stick to the bottom and side walls of each cup and subsequently require a massive cleaning effort. Not fun! I've had similar experiences with other popover pans in the past but this one made cleaning particularly difficult, for some reason. I'm going to try a silicone popover pan as a last result before I stop making these altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great pan.
customer_reviews.text: High quality pan, very sturdy, the grande is def bigger than I expected. My popovers were tall, didn’t take the traditional shape. I’m sure it’s something I did... it was my first time trying it. Super easy to clean as well. Great buy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Iman

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: It is a tradition to make Popovers every summer when our family goes to Maine. This tradition has gone on for decades. I wanted to finally get a pan to make these while at home and as a surprise for my wife. It has worked great so far and I did not even have to use butter/nonstick spray. The popovers slid right out.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Been making popovers every week since purchasing this. Wish it came in a bigger size, but I guess 6 popovers is plenty for now. The handles are perfect for easy removal from the oven. Support easy to clean, just make sure to season the pan before each use.
customer_reviews.author: StephaniefromCA

customer_reviews.title: Love Pan - use different recipe however
customer_reviews.text: Love the pan. We did not use the Nordic Ware recipe however. Used the Better Homes and Garden recipe were the temp is 400 degrees for 40 minutes. No need to monkey around with using two different temps and times.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: non-stick coating did not work
customer_reviews.text: The non-stick coating did not work on this item. I used twice and both times the popovers stuck to the bottom of the cups. In addition. the cups are so deep that the popovers did not "pop over". Item is sturdy and heave cast but it just did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: J Sergio

customer_reviews.title: STUCK ON BOTTOM DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Wow, after 2 uses this pan stopped working! I can't get the popovers out....completely stuck on bottom and sides. There is no excuse for a $25 pan not to work beautifully. My other popover pan, which is actually a muffin pan works beautifully; I can lift them out with my hand. Thought I would upgrade to a real popover pan, but wasted my hard earned cash!!
customer_reviews.author: kimberly ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Putting the POP in your Popovers
customer_reviews.text: I'd used other pans before, and got pretty OK results. With this one, the popovers really POP right out of the cups. See other reviews for pictures. The additional bulk of this pan makes it easier to wash, while also providing a place to catch little batter dribbles that may fall while pouring.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love this popover pan
customer_reviews.text: It is solid and easy to clean. My first batch of popovers came out beautifully. I look forward to many more batches being made. So far, I have not complaints, concerning this popover pan.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other nordicware products
customer_reviews.text: 3 major minuses...1-Popovers stick, even with butter and flour dusting. 2-pan is cylindrical, so rise isn't the same and you miss that perfect bottom. 3-when nonstick failed after 2 years, warranty support told us to use dawn platinum to clean and prevent sticking, rather than replace.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Fried

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pan
customer_reviews.text: I dare anyone to complain about this pan (I'm sure I'll regret that)! (And don't think you can get away without a little butter/oil before baking). Almost no effort to clean and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: B. Levin

customer_reviews.title: I was worried about the other Teflon or non stick pans due to their toxins and one of your reviewers convinced me than this pan
customer_reviews.text: Just received this. I was worried about the other Teflon or non stick pans due to their toxins and one of your reviewers convinced me than this pan was a far better choice. He had spent the time to thoroughly research this. I made some popovers in my new pan. I have never made them before and they came out perfect. They looked great and tasted fabulous. I used the directions that came with the pan but took the Barefoot Contessa 's advice and made sure all the ingredients were room temp. And I heated the greased pan for 2 minutes before filling with batter.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: We are loving tall restaurant-style popovers at home!
customer_reviews.text: The Nordic-Ware pan is pretty good, solid, stiff, apparent quality of design. The non-stick coating is good, not perfect as ours gets browns spots which are difficult to clean, but so far have no effect on use. I wish it was dishwasher safe. All that aside, it makes a great tall popover and they release easily from the pan.
customer_reviews.author: electriccafe

customer_reviews.title: it is very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: After having given away my popover pans thinking I could no longer make them at high altitude, I wanted to try again. My old pans worked at sea level, but had sharper edges, making them uncomfortable to work with. After reading reviews, I decided to try the Nordic Ware Grand Popover Pan... using a recipe for high altitude and this pan has worked out very well! A bonus is that I can put the pan in the dishwasher; it is very easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Nice popover pan
customer_reviews.text: All these non-stick pans work fine when they are new, time will tell if it holds up. So far probably 5 or 6 batches and still good. IIRC because they are a bit heavier but made of aluminum the outside of the popovers were slightly darker but still good.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Best Pan for Popovers!
customer_reviews.text: After spending a few days at the Cosmos Club in Washington, DC, I was once again enamored by awesomeness of popovers! I quickly went on line and found a great recipe from Alton Brown and then went on my search for the best popover pan. This pan does not disappoint! The pan is very sturdy and cleans up well. The aluminum conducts the heat very well and results in excellent popovers. From my experience with the pan, there is an advantage to heating it for a bit in the oven prior to filling with batter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: Best popovers ever!
customer_reviews.text: This pan makes the BEST popovers ever! I highly recommend using the Williams Sonoma popover recipe (just Google it) for the most delicious popovers that are perfectly crispy outside and warm and soft inside. The pan is practically indestructible and it easily cleans up afterwards like new. No creases or folds which means no rust ever. And they're made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Kona408

customer_reviews.title: Mile high Pop-overs!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas since Pop-overs were her favorite treat when she was a little girl. She is thrilled with this pan and has shown me pics of just how high her Pop-overs get! Anyone who makes Pop-overs knows that the pan must be preheated and HOT in order to make you Pop-overs high and light. This pan does not disappoint. Now I need to get one for me as well.
customer_reviews.author: Julz

customer_reviews.title: I love this pan
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan! I wish I had bought it years ago. The popovers turn out huge and picture perfect. They are light and fluffy and so delicious. In the past I used a muffin tin and there is no comparison on the popover you get when using this pan. They are easy to remove from the pan and the pan is easy to clean. I highly recommend this pan to anyone wanting to make the perfect popover. You will not regret buying this pan if you love popovers.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my recipes
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect size for David Lebovitz’s recipe for Panisse Puffs, pg 245 of My Paris Kitchen. I have smaller ones from a noted flour company and they are too small to add any filling should you wish to.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Best popover pan I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This pan is a gamechanger for great popovers. The muffin pan has been retired as this pan surpasses its performance in every facet. Cleans up like charm as well.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great pan ... great recipe
customer_reviews.text: The recipe that came with this pan for the popovers was perfect. And, the pan fits very nice in the Wolfgang Pressure Oven (that's why I bought this pan to begin with).
customer_reviews.author: DQ2

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this pan once and I was very happy with it. The popovers were wonderful! I do butter the pan, and the popovers came out very easily. There was no sticking. The coating on the other pan that I had came off on the bottom of the popovers and I had to throw that pan away. I hope that doesn't happen with this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Joan C.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING POPOVER PAN
customer_reviews.text: This Nordic Ware popover pan is great! It's really weighty, and produced the BEST popovers.......with absolutely minimal cleanup. I used the simple recipe which accompanied the pan. Following a suggestion, I greased the cups and pan top with a little solid shortening (Crisco) prior to pouring the batter in and VOILA! Popovers popped right up and didn't stick to the pan at all. I'm going to tweak the recipe and add an egg yolk. I think it will make them even tastier!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Makes wonderful tall popovers`
customer_reviews.text: I made gluten free popovers in this pan and they popped almost as well as the regular flour. This is not what usually happens. Also the pan was a breeze to clean.
customer_reviews.author: lcmmb

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan for my wife and she loves it! Great quality product. The only issue is she is baking too many popovers and I am eating too many of them?!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the only pan to use for making popovers. They rise up tall and get a little crusty all over. Easy to clean. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: KarenC

customer_reviews.title: solid product
customer_reviews.text: Makes great popovers -- better ones than with our old pan. Being all one piece means it's much less likely to degrade or break over time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lindberg

customer_reviews.title: but didn't look like those I had eaten in restaurants
customer_reviews.text: Tried making popovers with regular muffin pan, but didn't look like those I had eaten in restaurants. Popovers, however, made in this pan rise beautifully and taste great. Arrived very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect the very first time
customer_reviews.text: I saw Popover's being made on a TV cooking show and decided to purchase this pan. I expected a so-so result on my first try, being that it may have to be "broken in" or that I would goof up the recipe. NOT SO! The popovers were picture perfect and absolutely delicious. They popped right out of the buttered pan. Clean up in the sink with soapy water took seconds. I'm a huge fan of this and all the other NordicWare products I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: peasantmama

customer_reviews.title: Makes all the difference!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using regular muffin tins to make popovers but they never really got real big and fluffy so based on the good reviews I decided to try this pan-THE PAN MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE IN THE WORLD!!! Now every time I make popovers they are light, fluffy, and big-plus now I can get them crispy on the outside too which is totally delicious! If you make popovers you definitely NEED this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Taubea

customer_reviews.title: It’s so much better quality than the cheaper ones
customer_reviews.text: Looove this pan! It’s heavy & cooks the popovers evenly. It’s so much better quality than the cheaper ones. I followed the recipe that came with it and they barely filled the cups half way. Double the recipe or use another!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect popovers every time!
customer_reviews.text: This pan heats evenly and my popovers were gigantic! I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make popovers for Thanksgiving and they came out excellent! It is a great pan. Was easy to clean and feels really well made. Not lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: BarbJ

customer_reviews.title: This makes the BEST popovers? Yorkshire pudding
customer_reviews.text: This pan made it so easy to make popovers! Just enough room for expansion of the pudding. came out perfect, met my expectations and so much easier than a cupcake pan, using every other one for expansion . Clean up was easier than expected.., just wiped out with damp cloth. Highly recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great Popover Pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Nordic Ware Popover pan. It's heavy weight, not cheap. And it works great. Popovers come out of the oven big and delicious and fall right out of the pan. I'm glad I bought this pan.Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JayP

customer_reviews.title: Made in America
customer_reviews.text: Excellent popover pan. The popovers come out easily. Quality well made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Judy's friend

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Pan and Good Company
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pan .We made wonderful popovers. The design, and weight of the pan is perfect.The first one that arrived had some pits in the metal. I contacted Nordic Ware, and they sent me a new one immediately, and credited my acct. before I even returned the pan. It was a pleasure doing buisness with this Co. I would highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Popovers Do Not Stick to this!
customer_reviews.text: Have been making popovers for years. My husband and I love them for a light breakfast with coffee. My old pan was just bare metal and I used safflower oil on it once and ruined it. Popovers had to be cut out of the pan. I have several Nordic Ware pans that are so easy to clean and this one is no exception. I'll be ordering another so I can make popovers for the grand kids.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy but still can't get the popovers out, no matter how well greased the pan. Gluten free popovers don't seem to form properly at the bottom of each cup, or are undercooked. Seems like it was easier in muffin tin. Maybe more trial and error will solve these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Four

customer_reviews.title: Size and ease of cleaning was great.
customer_reviews.text: These pans clean up so nice. I make popovers every year and give them to different families every year. My last pan had seen it’s days so this made my Thanksgiving - giving easier.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Rock

customer_reviews.title: The best deal on quality Nordic Ware Popover pan!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic deal! It's Nordic Ware, so the quality of the product is there, and this is the best price anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: MattDat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: We used this in conjunction with the King Arthur Flour Popover mix. They came out perfect. Note: KAF sells the same pan at their website for about twice the cost. USA made and well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Best choice!
customer_reviews.text: Great popover pan -- I had been using Pyrex custard cups and the comparison of the results is amazing! Liked it so well I bought one for a friend who is a novice popover maker!!! It is a quality pan -- heavier than I expected. I read tons of reviews before I chose this one and feel I made the right choice!
customer_reviews.author: pat m

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Essentially
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Essentially, the same item sold though a "certain high-end cookware store", but different color...at a great price. Works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Tschudy

customer_reviews.title: Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is the best popover pan ever! No sticking, and popovers come out perfect every time. Highly recommend purchasing one of these if you want delicious, impressive popovers. And, don't forget, King Arthur flour only!!! No need to spend all that extra money on package mixes.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect popovers
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly. The popovers were beautiful. They cooked evenly and came out of the pan easily. My guests were so impressed. I served them warm with strawberry butter like they do at Neiman Marcus Rotunda in San Francisco. Delicious! I found the recipe online for both the popovers and butter.
customer_reviews.author: Lyrret B

customer_reviews.title: I finally bought a popover pan
customer_reviews.text: I used the king Arthur flour recipe for popovers. It's better than a standard muffin pan. I would recommend putting a cookie sheet under this pan because some of the batter went over the side.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie

customer_reviews.title: Great popover pan!
customer_reviews.text: Makes great popovers. Better than the Chicago brand. Had both pans in the oven at the same time and this pan rose up quicker and baked nicer. This is the better choice.
customer_reviews.author: A.. Vidrick

customer_reviews.title: Makes fantastic popovers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan to make my Yorkshire puddings, they turned out the best that I had ever made. So easy to clesan, will have to purchase another for when I hjave company!!
customer_reviews.author: Fl. Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pans!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! We have prime rib and Yorkshire puddings every year for Christmas dinner. I've always used muffin tins but these are so much better. Sturdy, did not stick and the puddings were so high and puffy! Love these pans!
customer_reviews.author: kimberleypea

customer_reviews.title: Great Popover pan
customer_reviews.text: A nice, heavy popover pan, attractive enough to put on the table to serve from. Replaces my worn pan and sure to be frequently used.
customer_reviews.author: Fozwort

customer_reviews.title: Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and worth every penny. Initially I used the recipe that came with the pan but it didn't work for me so now I use the recipe from the King Arthur Flour website. Since there are only two of us most of the time I cut the recipe in half and it makes four good size popovers. I will likely be purchasing another in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I use to make popovers! Cleans so easily. Bread comes out great! Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: denise mcleod

customer_reviews.title: easy perfect popovers
customer_reviews.text: Popovers can be a bit difficult to make. We always used cast iron and it took practice to get them to reach full size. This cast aluminum pan seemed a bit light at first, but our first batch of popovers all came out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the dollars spent!
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality & how easy this pan is to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dian Terry

customer_reviews.title: If You Like Popovers, You'll love this Pan!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my wife. She loves it and I enjoy consuming the fruits of her labors using this Popover Pan!
customer_reviews.author: MGA MKII

customer_reviews.title: Very excellent pan!
customer_reviews.text: Follow directions for your recipe. My popovers were fantastic. I’ve been making them for years in a muffin tin. This pan changed everything!
customer_reviews.author: AKBernadine

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used much in our hot weather but plan to use more as weather cools.
customer_reviews.author: Unsoded Dome

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This pan cleans easily. I actually did not preheat it, just buttered and floured the cups before pouring the batter in and baked these in the middle rack at 425F. Combined Martha Stewart's and Allrecipes.com recipes into 1 and it worked extremely well. Happy Baking!
customer_reviews.author: Fortunella

customer_reviews.title: Best Popover Pan EVER
customer_reviews.text: There has never been a better popover pan. We have had a couple of others and they always had some sticking. This pan never holds on to the popovers. They come out perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: The right pan makes the difference.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pan I've purchased. The first one was way less expensive and lighter weight. My popovers never popped. I decided to purchase this pan because it looked sturdier...and it is. It has made a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: B. McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Nordic Ware grand popover pan
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the cup cake tins I have been using. Huge Popovers..I recommend to not fill too much, if not you will get fewer popovers but they are big..
customer_reviews.author: Trust

customer_reviews.title: Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: The first time my wife tried the pans, the popovers turned out great! Now whenever she's in mood for popovers, she can make them whenever she the craving hits her.
customer_reviews.author: Lupe Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of these popover plans. I prefer the sturdy Nordic Ware over the wire frame models.
customer_reviews.author: ALF Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan, it's sturdy and cleans up so easily...Now, if only I could make a decent batch of popovers!
customer_reviews.author: Hel Filfölder

customer_reviews.title: Popover delight
customer_reviews.text: Great pan for popovers - easy to clean, and conducive to great popovers when done right. That said, the crucial thing with popovers isn't so much the pan as properly greasing the pan. So grease well!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan WellsTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular pan!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pan!! The best popovers pan I’ve ever had. Will be buying it again and again for gifts!!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: All these years trying to make popovers look like popovers and little did I know
customer_reviews.text: All these years trying to make popovers look like popovers and little did I know, you just need the right pan! Love this item.
customer_reviews.author: pbmb

customer_reviews.title: Great big popovers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted both sizes popover pans since I'm really obsessed with them. If you follow directions they will slip right out of the pan. This pan will probably last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: My popovers were a huge hit with this pan - I did not use their recipe though - just make sure you spray it well before using and make sure your milk and eggs are at room temperature before baking
customer_reviews.author: One Bella Casa

customer_reviews.title: Great popover pan
customer_reviews.text: I have used it 4 times and love it. Very easy clean up. Great popovers every time.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Fields

customer_reviews.title: Nordic Ware never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: My gluten free popovers came out perfectly using this pan. Be warned: these popovers are large. But that's a good thing, no?
customer_reviews.author: Michele Bremke

customer_reviews.title: ... made - heavy metal so holds heat well - easy to handle - does the job nicely
customer_reviews.text: Well made - heavy metal so holds heat well - easy to handle - does the job nicely!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rimolt

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Had one for years and makes the best popovers! Bought my latest one for a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Portland, ME

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Popovers!
customer_reviews.text: This pan has been perfect for making popovers. We bought it in February 2013 and have used it several times with consistantly great results. It is made of heavy duty metal and cleans easily. Make sure your batter is room temperature!
customer_reviews.author: Scot Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality, and worth it!  Never sticks, cleans easy, and you can get 8" popovers easy!
customer_reviews.text: Professional quality, and worth it! Never sticks, cleans easy, and you can get 8" popovers easy! Reccomend it highly for impressing your in-laws.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hedger

customer_reviews.title: A quality pan!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a young friend who is becoming quite a baker. He loves it! It's much lighter than the one I used to use, and is also very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money! Perfect popovers. I have tried other pans and None come close to the this one. It's solidly built, nice weight and very easy to clean. Can't recommend it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah22

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: Great pan, great price. Have not had popovers stick from the very first time I used it. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Southern GalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for popovers, this is a sturdy, good quality pan.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great nonstick. Straight sides make unusual shaped popovers.
customer_reviews.text: I love the nonstick quality of this pan but you can't beat custard cups for the correct shape of a popover.
customer_reviews.author: sensible shoes

customer_reviews.title: Makes great popovers.
customer_reviews.text: Use in a toaster oven and it does a good job. We also have the larger one but this one is good for smaller popovers.
customer_reviews.author: GVW

customer_reviews.title: We love popovers
customer_reviews.text: This pan produces light and very tall popovers. I had used custard cups and muffin tins before and the difference is astounding. It is very easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: old vermonter

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best popover pan I have ever used. Very well made and the popovers do not stick.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rattigan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: as good as popover pans get, solidly made, even heat, cleans well, looks good after many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nordic Ware Grand Popover Pan
customer_reviews.text: The popover pans were exactly what i was looking. The pan is durable, easy to clean and makes great popovers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a premium price. Although I do not like non stick coatings this is a heavy duty,beautiful pan.Will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D. Verfaillie

customer_reviews.title: Great Popover Pan!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and thick--my popover recipe rose nicely, and it is new, but the non-stick is great--they power-slided right out!
customer_reviews.author: Todd MarchTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, Non-Stick
customer_reviews.text: As with any cookware you need to be aware of how to use it. Experiment with your recipe. This cleans up nicely and with the right recipe works great. I preheat and use a less stiff mixture, but results will vary. Do not thing of this as a deep muffin pan, adjust your method. Use their recipe first, exactly as written, then make minor changes. The Pan itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: JL Price in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Yorkshire pudding!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make popovers/Yorkshire puddings, and also to make meat muffins (individual portions of meatloaf, with nice crispy edges. Don't think I'll ever make traditional meatloaf again.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very pleased with quality and performance to date.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Nordic ware pop over pan is a real winner from down under !!
customer_reviews.text: Wow -- I used the William Sonoma cookbook recipe and this new Nordic ware pop over pan -- what a gem of a product -- they turned out perfect ! ie ., tall and nicely gooey on the inside -- a real treat . I am ordered to use this weekly !!
customer_reviews.author: John Merlo

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of pop-over pans!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome popovers. heavy duty and non-stick. Comes with a great recipe. Pleased the masses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nordic Ware Grand Popover Pan
product_meta.description: Style Name:Grand Popover PanNordic Ware Grand Popover Pan makes six tasty popovers at a time. The cast aluminum bakeware provides fine details and superior baking performance. The heat reflective exteriors allows for uniform browning so as to enhance the unique design. Bake mouth watering 3/4 cup popovers and over-sized muffins. Also perfect for crown muffins, yorkshire pudding, and molded desserts. Our center heat vents allow hot air to surround the popover for even cooking. Heavy cast aluminum assures it will not warp and provides long-lasting service. Non-stick finish for easy cleaning. Limited lifetime warranty. Proudly made in the USA by Nordic Ware.
feature_bullets: Bake mouth watering popovers and over-sized muffins.
Heavy cast aluminum for even heating and exceptional durability
Nonstick coating for easy food release and cleanup
